required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nasal Gel for the Prevention of Nausea and Vomiting Associated With Motion
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Phase 3 Study of the Efficacy and Safety of DPI-386 Nasal Gel for the Prevention of Nausea and Vomiting Associated With Motion

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 3, two-arm, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, single dose efficacy and safety study evaluating the use of a nasal gel to prevent nausea and vomiting associated with motion

detailed_description.textblock:
Eligible participants will be randomized 1:1 to DPI-386 Nasal Gel or matching placebo nasal gel and assigned a time and date for travel on an ocean vessel. Participants will be asked to self-administer the study medication while the ship is in harbor. The Modified Performance Self-Assessment Questionnaire (mPSAQ) will be completed by each participant prior to the administration of nasal gel, approximately every 30 minutes of travel, and at the end of travel. The participants will complete the Nausea Assessment Scale (NAS) every 30 minutes afer dosing, and at the end of travel. The participants will also be asked to complete a Sopite Assessment Questionnaire (SAQ) and a Patient Global Assessment of Severity (PGI-S) at 4 hours to describe their travel experience. All questionnaires will be submitted for analysis. An exit interview will also be conducted.
The treatment phase will last approximately 4-5 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants who report no vomiting within 4 hours after receiving study drug and no use of rescue treatment (e.g., dimenhydrinate) within 4 hours after receiving study drug (Complete Responders).
primary_outcome.description: Participants who report no vomiting within 4 hours after receiving study drug and no use of rescue treatment (e.g., dimenhydrinate) within 4 hours after receiving study drug

arm_group.description: Each 0.12 gram of the gel contains 0.2 mg of scopolamine HBr

intervention.description: Subjects will self-administer DPI-386 Nasal Gel or Placebo
Subjects will self-administer DPI-386 Nasal Gel or Placebo
